recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Classic chewy chocolate chip cookies with crispy edges and gooey centers.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together until creamy.
Add the vanilla extract and eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing just until combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown around the edges but still soft in the center.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain the rest.
In a large skillet, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crispy. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to combine with pancetta.
Remove the skillet from heat and quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tacos al Pastor
recipes.description: Delicious tacos filled with marinated pork, pineapple, and onions, served with fresh cilantro and lime.
instructions: In a blender, combine garlic, achiote paste, orange juice, and white vinegar to make the marinade.
In a large bowl, combine the pork slices with the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the pork until browned and cooked through.
Warm the corn tortillas on the grill or skillet.
Serve the pork on the tortillas, topped with diced pineapple, chopped onion, and fresh cilantro. Add a squeeze of lime juice and season with salt and black pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.description: A spicy, stir-fried Chinese dish made with chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, and cornstarch to make the sauce.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the dried red chilies and stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the cubed chicken and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add the garlic, bell pepper, and peanuts, and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables, and stir to coat evenly.
Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.description: A rich and creamy curry made with tender chicken pieces in a spiced tomato sauce.

ingredients.name: Chicken thighs
ingredients.quantity: 1 pound, boneless and skinless, cut into chunks

instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, and salt. Add the chicken chunks and marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until golden brown.
Add cumin, coriander, and turmeric, and cook for another minute.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until the chicken is no longer pink.
Add the tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the heavy cream and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Sushi Rolls
recipes.description: Traditional Japanese sushi rolls made with vinegared rice, seafood, and vegetables, wrapped in nori seaweed.
instructions: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to the package instructions. Let it cool slightly.
In a small saucepan, heat rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until dissolved. Pour over the cooked rice and mix gently.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo sushi mat. Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
Place slices of fish, cucumber, and avocado in a line along the bottom edge of the rice.
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat, pressing gently to shape.
Slice the roll into bite-sized pieces using a sharp knife.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

recipes.name: Crepes
recipes.description: Thin and delicate French pancakes that can be filled with sweet or savory fillings.
instructions: In a blender, combine all ingredients and blend until smooth. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Pour a small amount of batter into the skillet, swirling to evenly coat the bottom.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until the edges begin to lift, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Repeat with the remaining batter, greasing the skillet as needed.
Fill the crepes with your choice of sweet or savory fillings and fold or roll to serve.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.description: A popular Thai stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, shrimp, peanuts, scrambled eggs, and bean sprouts.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for about 20 minutes or until soft. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix fish sauce, tamarind paste, and brown sugar to make the sauce.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through.
Push the shrimp to one side and pour the beaten eggs into the other side of the skillet. Scramble the eggs until fully cooked.
Add the soaked noodles, bean sprouts, and sauce to the skillet. Toss to combine all ingredients.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the noodles are heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped peanuts, green onions, red chili flakes, and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Moussaka
recipes.description: A traditional Greek casserole made with layers of eggplant, ground lamb, and béchamel sauce.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Salt the eggplant slices and let them sit for 30 minutes to draw out moisture. Rinse and pat dry.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet and fry the eggplant slices until golden brown. Set aside on paper towels to drain excess oil.
In the same skillet, cook the ground lamb with chopped onion and garlic until browned.
Add tomato paste, red wine, cinnamon, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
In a saucepan, melt butter and stir in flour to make a roux. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly until thickened.
Layer half of the eggplant slices in a baking dish. Top with the lamb mixture, then add another layer of eggplant.
Pour the béchamel sauce over the top and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes or until the top is golden and bubbly.
Let cool slightly before serving.

recipes.name: Tabbouleh
recipes.description: A fresh and flavorful salad made with bulgur, parsley, mint, tomatoes, and a lemon vinaigrette.
instructions: Soak the bulgur wheat in hot water for about 20 minutes, or until tender. Drain any excess water.
In a large bowl, combine the soaked bulgur, chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes, cucumber, and green onions.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve chilled.
